alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Alleghany, southwestern Bath Counties in west central Virginia and east central Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 315 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Neola, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Neola... Warm Springs... Hot Springs... Lake Moomaw... Mountain Grove... Douthat State Park... and Ingalls Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
